page.title: 11LANDRAKE VILLAGE CARNIVAL
page.content: Originally known as Strawberry Fayre, the first Saturday in July is now Landrake Carnival Day. Carnival week begins the previous Sunday with community hymn singing in either{church}or{chapel.}During the week evening events are staged -mini marathon for children & adults,sports, tractor pull.On Saturday morning the organisations prepare stalls around the village square.Official opening in early afternoon,Carnival Queen crowned stalls open and fun begins. A band leads the procession of floats through the village and down part of the A38.Lorries and farm tractors are converted to show various tableaux. Visiting Carnival Queens compete for prizes.Majorettes give a marching display,village school children dance around a{Maypole.}Young & old can join in dancing in the Square from 8pm.
